intro: Diplomeris boxallii, commonly known as the Boxall's diplomeris, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to South Africa, specifically found in the Western Cape region. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Diplomeris boxallii is a relatively rare species, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
